reviews.title: an old hotel between the "Trump" towers
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights before our Cruise in January. What a super deal for an older hotel right on a swimming beach. It is about an hour busride north from the busy part of Southbeach. We were glad to be away from the 24hr. noise. Shopping was good here, safe, beach- gorgeous, nightly hotel entertainment consisted of a singing DJ, with added piano, guitar or sax. The bar had one DJ and another in the restaurant. The hotel was apparently owned by a French Canadian from Montreal, lots of French speaking guests. The property was well kept, staff pleasant..location- good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place was a time trip back to the fifties in decor and feel. We got last open room and were visiting nearby, so we tried it out. Parking in front is a nightmare with one overworked attendant trying to park, retrieve, and manage traffic all at once. Room was OK but bath had one glass shelf, about 4inch wide and 18 inch long for your use. There was a locked pass through door in the back of the room, that we found out, in the middle of the night, leads to another rooms bathroom. You heard everything, including toilet activity. Yuch. We got up early just to get out of there fast. Front office didn't care a bit about anything. I think they're just riding out the string till they sell to a developer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even when it is no Best Western anymore, this did not mean that the service has changed. We can say we were absolutely content with our 3 nights stay. We love to get out of the room and set our feet on the beach without crossing a street. The hotel is perfect for a beach vacation. The rooms were clean again, and the staff was friendly as always. If you don`t expect a highly decorated luxurious hotel and can live with the charme of one of the last familiar hotels directly at the beach it should be a good choice.
reviews.title: it's okay

reviews.text: Hotel looks good from the outside, lobby looks nice, room looks nice to, but you can see that the hotel has his years and needs some renovation(stairways, elevator and hallway. They need to put carpets in the hallway, cause when you are sleeping you can hear people dragging suitcases and women with high heels walking. room was okay, They have shuttles that goes to aventura mall and southbeach. wireless internet acces in the lobby. one of the front desk clerk is a little bit rude. Pool site is nice.. breakfast is good. Good place to stay if you don't stay much in the hotel on your vacations, like me.. get up hit the road till in the evening

reviews.title: This is a Best Western?
reviews.text: I visted this hotel with some friends in Feb. 05 for 5 days, the hotel staff was ok and the concierge was very helpful...even though we got ripped off when we paid twice the amount for a casino cruise that the concierge arranged for us. The beach was great ...but the hotel rooms were kinda average and old looking..this hotel needs a definite upgrade. The majority of the people on the beach and staying at this hotel were senior citezens who (i was told) are regulars to this hotel. I accidently left a pair of shoes @ the hotel and I called them several times and the front desk would connect me to housekeeping and no one would ever answer the phone. I called them for several weeks and no one seemed to care that I had left something there and wanted it returned to me..they just kept puting me on hold and I never got a straight answer about my shoes. This hotel is pretty crappy for a Best Western Chain...I was kinda surprised by the quality of the hotel and the lack of customer service at the hotel.

reviews.title: Beautiful spot directly on the beach
reviews.text: We had a great time in this hotel, booked a standardroom and got an upgrade room, ground floor, with poolview, own terrace an entry to the pool! That was really cool. Our room was big and had a little kitchen. Absolutely comfortable. Hotelservice was really nice and friendly. The hot tub in the beautiful tropical garden is nearlly too hot, but five minutes inside is o.k.!

reviews.title: average hotel
reviews.text: A few steps on the other side of the street is a great "publix", we loved that. Also a drugstore is steps away. So you can buy anything you need for relaxing holidays on the beach. You will find here lovely warm water on the beach in beautiful colours and a fantastic sunrise every morning. I felt always very safe at this beach and had long walks up and down .
So we come back surely. Have fun!!!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel 21 years ago with a couple of my friends and i returned this year with my wife and kids.The entire area of Sunny Isles Beach has changed.There is construction everywhere.This hotel is one of the last remaining low-rise hotels and from looking at the trump van in the front of the building,it is not going to be for long.
